intro: Convolvulus boissieri subsp. compactus, commonly known as the compact convolvulus, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a perennial herb with prostrate or ascending stems that bear small, funnel-shaped flowers in shades of pink to purple. The plant produces capsule fruits containing numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates.
